text: well here we go packing for the big
Africa trip got all my stuff laid out on
the bed nicely this one's gonna be a
wild adventure
[Music]
tomorrow I'm heading on a nine country
solo trip around Central and West Africa
Namibia Angola South Tomei Gabon
Cameroon Equatorial Guinea Chad Mali and
Mauritania to be honest this is the most
intimidated I've been for any trip
because most of these countries are not
built for tourism
some of them like Cameroon are
undergoing a civil war others like Chad
have laws against filming in public
areas this will be my first test of real
sub-saharan Africa and since I'll be
alone I need to take extra caution to
stay safe right over especially with all
my new camera gear here are three ways
I'm preparing for this trip to ensure
safety one finding local contacts in
each country I've gotten in touch with
either a friend a follower or a friend
of a follower to pick me up post me
and/or show me around
Ivan and I are walking around the
streets of Kigali I've been doing this
around the world for the past few years
and it's proven to be the best way to
maximize my experience in any country
and of course not have to worry about
language barriers to smart hotel booking
I purchased all of my hotels in advance
on booking.com I've used their service
since the day I started traveling in
2012 to book more than 500 properties
around the world their platform is the
most efficient and easy to use for
booking accommodations with the most
options available for each place I make
sure there is free Wi-Fi and free
cancellation until the day before
arrival just in case any plans change
three strategic flight bookings I made
sure that every flight I booked takes
off and arrives in daylight I've learned
from past experiences in sub-saharan
Africa that arriving late at night or
early morning is not always the safest
in the dark most of these airports will
be empty except for a few sketchy taxi
drivers that will try to rip me off or
worse also arriving in the darkness is
exposing yourself to be as vulnerable as
possible and considering my white skin
red hair and all my equipment daylight
makes everything better so I'm here in
Uganda and the kids are made
I'm gonna take this one home lastly I'll
be making sure that my phone works with
either my t-mobile global SIM card or a
local one that I'll be picking up it was
like 10 bucks for three gigabytes is
gonna didn't now be talking to your
rightful now connected I will always use
Google Maps to navigate and have about
two thousand dollars in US cash
separated in different parts of my bag I
brought very few clothes to keep my
backpack light and I'm mentally
preparing for this wild adventure that
begins tomorrow
I'll see you in Namibia
